Sentencas: The mechanism of H2O dissociation as well as the adsorption and oxidation reaction of H-2 on yttria-stabilized zirconia (YSZ), commonly used as part of solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) anodes, was investigated employing temperature-programmed desorption (TPD) spectroscopy and density functional theory (DFT).
Titulo: H2O chemisorption and H2 oxidation on yttria-stabilized zirconia: Density functional theory and temperature-programmed desorption studies

Sentencas: In agreement with theory the experimental results show that interaction of gaseous H2O with YSZ results in dissociative adsorption leading to strongly bound OH surface species.
Titulo: H2O chemisorption and H2 oxidation on yttria-stabilized zirconia: Density functional theory and temperature-programmed desorption studies

Sentencas: In the interaction of gaseous H-2 with an oxygen-enriched YSZ surface (YSZ + O) similar OH surface species are formed as reaction intermediates in the H-2 oxidation.
Titulo: H2O chemisorption and H2 oxidation on yttria-stabilized zirconia: Density functional theory and temperature-programmed desorption studies

Titulo: H2O chemisorption and H2 oxidation on yttria-stabilized zirconia: Density functional theory and temperature-programmed desorption studies

Sentencas: The experimental H2O desorption data is used to access the accuracy of the H-2/H2O/YSZ adsorption/desorption and surface reaction kinetics data, employed in previous modeling studies of the electrochemical H-2 oxidation on Ni-pattern/YSZ model anodes by Vogler et al.
